name: waffle
content:
waffle verb [I]
(TALK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
UK to talk or write a lot without giving any useful information or any clear answers: If you don't know the answer, it's no good just waffling (on) for pages and pages.

waffle verb [I]
(FAIL TO DECIDE)
US (UK dither) to be unable to make a decision: I waffled a lot before finally deciding to take the job.
waffle noun
(CAKE)
[ C ] a type of bread or cake made from batter (= a thin mixture of milk, flour, and egg) cooked in a special pan whose surface forms a pattern of raised squares

(TALK)

(NOT DECIDE)
